body.name: Introducing Ring Stick Up Cam Pro Plug-In | Two-Way Talk with Audio+, 3D Motion Detection with Bird’s Eye Zones, and 1080p HDR Video & Color Night Vision (2023 release), White
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 14 hrs 15 mins
features: Pro-level security – Introducing Stick Up Cam Pro, upgraded protection for your home with advanced features like 1080p HDR Video & Color Night Vision, Two-Way Talk with Audio+, and 3D Motion Detection with Bird’s Eye Zones.
HDR Video – Watch over your home day or night in 1080p HDR video with Color Night Vision.
Bird's Eye View -See where someone's been and how they got there with an aerial view.
Video previews – Record a few extra seconds before every motion event with Advanced Pre-Roll to get a more complete picture of what happened.
Plug-in power – Plugs into standard power outlets for nonstop power.
Weather-resistant – Built to withstand normal rainfall and snow, so you can put pro-grade security inside or out.
Additional protection – Save and share video and photos with an optional Ring Protect Plan (subscription sold separately).

Designed for sustainability – This device’s is made from 19% recycled materials. 100% recyclable of this device’s packaging is made of wood fiber-based materials from responsibly managed forests or recycled sources.

productInformation.name: Dimensions
productInformation.value: 6.06 in x 2.76 in x 2.76 in (153.9 mm x 70 mm x 70 mm)

productInformation.name: Video
productInformation.value: 1080p HDR, Live View, Color Night Vision

productInformation.name: Motion Detection
productInformation.value: 3D Motion Detection with Bird's Eye Zones and Bird's Eye View, Custom Motion Zones up to 30 feet

productInformation.name: Audio
productInformation.value: Two-Way Talk with Audio+ and advanced noise cancellation

productInformation.name: Power
productInformation.value: USB-C Power Adapter (total length: 19.7 feet/6 meters)

productInformation.name: Internet Requirements
productInformation.value: Requires a minimum upload speed of 2 Mbps for optimal performance.

productInformation.name: Dual Power Mode
productInformation.value: Dynamic switching between plug-in and battery power modes (requires purchase of battery pack)

productInformation.name: Setup Requirements
productInformation.value: Integrated mounting base/stand with adjustable angle. Can sit freestanding or mount to a wall or ceiling. Standard power outlet.

productInformation.name: Box Includes
productInformation.value: Stick Up Cam Pro USB-C Power Adapter Install Hardware Setup Guide Warranty and Safety document Security Sticker

productInformation.name: Software Security Updates
productInformation.value: This device receives guaranteed software security updates until at least four years after the device is last available for purchase as a new unit on our websites. Learn more about software security updates. If you already own a Ring device, visit Software Security Updates in Ring Control Center for information specific to your device.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Connection & picture superb
reviews.reviewText: I have and have had multiple Ring cameras all over the inside and outside of my home for years now. Great product.I can’t say enough about Ring, it’s in my opinion the product leader.One thing about Ring, without the prescription it’s only use is real time and depending on your wireless connection speed or cell/computer you could miss the person at you door, outside your home in any area, or inside. In my opinion it’s a must to buy the yearly (cheaper if you pay the one time yearly prescription cost) prescription. With this you can go back in time to view and the videos can be saved up to ~180 days.I’ve used video for insurance and we’ve had some fun when accidental falls or other fun times being caught on video (partying essentially). Thankfully I have not needed Ring for any thieves, I believe having Ring cameras in and around your home is at times deterrent enough.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works well, excellent battery life
reviews.reviewText: I purchased the solar panel for this wireless ring cam but I am now four weeks in since installing it and I have 40% power left - battery life seems excellent. Image quality is good and integrated easily into our system. The only negative is that the image orientation can’t be inverted by the software - so you can only mount it one way.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Worked great until 28 days later
reviews.reviewText: Worked great, pre-roll and wider viewing image. Then 28 days later started showing black dots in the recording. I cleaned the lens, re-boot, unplugged and re-plugged. Black dots only appeared when looking at a red curb. If something else was in front of the red curb, everything was fine. Red curb looked like a dotted / dashed red line with black holes in it. All of a sudden it appeared on Day 28. Called Ring customer service, went through all these resets, then it went offline and took about 12 tries to restore it. But black specks remained. Ring said send it back to Amazon being it’s within 30 days. For $180 what a joke.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Overall good product for monitoring
reviews.reviewText: Our doorbell is at a side angle, so we got the Ring camera, instead. The features it has are nice, but it doesn't seem to monitor as far as I thought it would. But it is sensitive and even night vision is good. We had a package stolen from our porch before the Ring was installed, but even if it happened again, we would have a picture of the thief to share with the police.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to install used it for our ourdoor ring camera
reviews.reviewText: The night vision is great quality

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars It’s made of plastic
reviews.reviewText: The base was cheaply made.not worth the money

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Impressive WiFi range and solar charging capability
reviews.reviewText: I tried this on a whim as I'm already pretty deeply invested in the Ring ecosystem with at least 7 other wired Ring cameras. I wanted to see if I could use this as a trail cam about 100 yards from my house. Shockingly, it's working great at that distance. I had to ensure it was mounted so the tree it's on isn't directly in the line of sight between the camera and the WiFi AP in my living room, but once I did that it has been working flawlessly. RSSI sits at about -67 Additionally, I got this with the solar panel so I wouldn't have to charge it frequently and have been surprised at the effectiveness of the solar panel. I even have notifications set to frequent and highest sensitivity (against recommendations when running on battery). I was essentially just testing it in the location I placed the camera, so I just sat the solar panel on the ground next to the tree the camera is mounted on. It's actually under some brush (leaves are gone this time of year) and it's not really even pointing south, and yet, with this poor site selection for solar it has been maintaining the battery between 68 & 90% for weeks now during mostly overcast Michigan fall weather. I'm going to test in a few more locations and if it works in those, I plan to get an additional 2-pack of these. Recommended for those that need a wireless Ring cam and don't want to charge the battery regularly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Mostly great, but ceiling mounting give upside down video
reviews.reviewText: Setup is fairly easy, except the QR code is too tiny to be read by the Ring app so one has to manually enter in the PIN. Once done the rest of the setup is easy, and the product works pretty well. Motion detection is good and video quality is decent enough.But the ceiling mount is ludicrous. With the Stick Up cams, there is no way to invert the video, so when installed as directed you get an upside down image. It is annoying that Ring (i.e. Amazon) says the unit can be ceiling mounted, and there is even a section on that in the installation instructions. But if you follow the instruction, you’ll be looking at upside down images with no way to correct. Only after install did I find this out, as it is NOT mentioned anywhere in the description. Searching the Ring support archives, you’ll find a long thread going back several years on this, and Ring has still yet to correct this which is absurd - it would only take a simple software change to enable, and ironically this feature is available on older and cheaper indoor Ring cameras.It is unacceptable that Ring continues to advertise this camera as capable of ceiling mount, only to find that feature unusable. Fix it, Ring!!!!!
